revised_title: Long Time Behavior of Integrable Heisenberg Spin Chain
tldr: The author investigates the long-time behavior of an integrable Heisenberg spin chain, a type of spin system that is a discretization of the continuous Heisenberg magnet model and equivalent to a discretization of the nonlinear Schrödinger equation. The study focuses on the non-soliton part of the system and uses inverse scattering theory and Riemann-Hilbert factorization to analyze the problem, ultimately reducing it to a similar problem for the Toda lattice. The results provide explicit asymptotic formulae for the system.
